data_maturity_score.evidence: Mixed modern and legacy stack - Snowflake and DBT indicate modern practices, but Control M batch processing and Unix suggest legacy systems being modernized

data_maturity_level.evidence: Score of 3 indicates documented processes and modern tools (Snowflake, DBT) but with legacy components (Control M) suggesting transition phase

maturity_signals.evidence: Snowflake and DBT adoption indicates modern data stack, mentions testing and debugging processes

scope_creep_score.evidence: Well-defined data engineering role focused on ETL, data modeling, and production support without obvious scope expansion into other domains

overtime_risk_score.evidence: Consulting role with direct client interaction and production support responsibilities suggest potential for pressure, but no explicit overtime mentions

role_clarity.evidence: Focused data engineering role with specific technical requirements around Snowflake, DBT, ETL workflows, and clear responsibilities listed

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Moderate concerns around compensation transparency and location restriction, but role definition is clear and focused

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: No specific reporting structure, manager level, or team hierarchy mentioned in the job posting

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No manager level or reporting structure information provided in the job description

team_growth_velocity.evidence: No information about team size, growth plans, or hiring velocity mentioned

team_composition.evidence: No team composition, size, or structure information provided in the job posting

reporting_structure.evidence: No reporting structure, manager, or organizational hierarchy mentioned

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: Role appears to be within IBM Consulting delivery centers rather than embedded in client teams, focusing on internal data engineering work

work_life_balance_score.evidence: No PTO policy, benefits, or work-life balance mentions. Consulting role with production support suggests potential for pressure

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: No learning budgets, career growth paths, mentorship programs, or advancement opportunities mentioned

tech_culture_score.evidence: Mixed signals - modern tools (Snowflake, DBT) but traditional enterprise practices (Control M), no engineering culture mentions

tech_culture_signals.evidence: No tech culture indicators like open source, conferences, hackathons, or innovation time mentioned

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: Mentions testing and debugging processes, but no modern engineering practices like code review, CI/CD, or monitoring

innovation_signals.evidence: Focus on maintaining existing systems and redesigning Control M processes rather than innovation or new technology exploration

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: Mentions 'redesign Control M Batch processing for ETL job build to run efficiently' and 'evaluate effectiveness and developed new system to improve efficiency'

ai_integration_level.evidence: No AI, ML, or machine learning tools, frameworks, or responsibilities mentioned in the job posting

ml_tools_expected.evidence: No ML/AI tools mentioned - focus is entirely on traditional data engineering and ETL workflows

hiring_urgency.evidence: No urgent timeline, immediate start, or ASAP mentions - standard consulting hiring process

competition_level.evidence: IBM brand attracts candidates, but location restriction to Kochi limits competition. Mid-level role with 3+ years experience requirement

company_stage_inferred.evidence: IBM is a large, established enterprise company with global consulting operations and delivery centers

hiring_velocity.evidence: IBM Consulting typically has steady hiring for delivery centers to support client projects

team_size_signals.evidence: No specific team size mentioned for the data engineering team or broader organization

funding_stage_signals.evidence: IBM is a publicly traded, established enterprise company

role_creation_type.evidence: Consulting delivery centers typically expand teams based on client demand and project needs

strength_details: IBM brand provides stability and enterprise experience
Modern data stack with Snowflake and DBT adoption
Focused data engineering role with clear technical requirements
concern_details: No salary, benefits, or compensation information provided
Location restricted to Kochi, Kerala, India - no remote options
No career growth, learning opportunities, or advancement paths mentioned
Unclear reporting structure and team composition
best_fit_details: Mid-level data engineers (3-5 years) seeking stable enterprise experience
Engineers interested in batch ETL and data warehouse focus
Candidates based in or willing to relocate to Kochi, Kerala
probe_details: Ask about salary range, benefits, and total compensation package
Understand team size, composition, and reporting structure
Clarify work hours, on-call expectations, and production support requirements
Discuss career growth opportunities and advancement paths within IBM
leverage_details: Being already located in Kochi/Kerala eliminates relocation concerns
Strong match for Snowflake, DBT, and ETL experience requirements
summary.overall_assessment: Solid enterprise data engineering opportunity at IBM with modern tech stack (Snowflake, DBT) but limited growth prospects. Good for candidates seeking stable, traditional data warehouse experience in India. Main concerns are compensation transparency, location restriction, and unclear career development path.
